oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Gen. John Bell Hood to Gen. Joseph E. Johnston re: the death of Leonidas Polk
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter reads, "I am too sad to come over this evening. Tis hard that one so noble, generous & brave as our friend Genl Polk should be taken from us. It would be different had he been called from us in a great battle. Please let me know the particulars as to his death." Hood requested that his note be given to Polk's son or to someone on Polk's staff.
